name: Hotel 43

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When the owners of Hotel 43 decided to revamp and transform this old proprerty in downtown Boise and turn it into a swank and modern property, the owners should have stayed true to the vision - throughout the hotel and not cut corners when it came to space. Everything from a decor standpoint is brand new and very nicely done. However the ergonomics and space issues throughout the hotel keep this property from soaring to heights previously unavailable in Boise. The first time you notice the tight quarters is when you step off the elevator. We stayed on 6. Come off the elevator and the hallway is so tight, you cannot walk two people pulling roll-away bags down the hall without bumping into each other. Next, the rooms are very small - no more than 300 square feet. Again, nicely decorated, modern furnishings, the bed was comfortable, and HVAC worked well. The room was clean and tidy. wireless interent access was however unavailable - which is unforgiveable for a new property. But - by far - the most confining part of the hotel stay was the impossibly small bathroom. I could not use the toliet without the door striking my knees. It's impossible to step out of the tub without closing the bathroom door. My wife and I felt like we were stationed on a submarine in that bathroom. The shower head in the bath tub was mounted at chest height - I'm 5'9 - not that tall -so to get my head wet I had to duck down. We really had higher expectations, and recieved a fair nightly rate, but this one is not for the claustraphobic. At this point - it's too late to fix these issues, they would have to remove walls and completely redo the space. It's a shame, it's really a nice place, great downtown location but comes up short on space.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Grove, but no more. Hotel 43 was simply perfect. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk was delightfully friendly and very helpful; they even lead you to your room and present you with a custom-made chocolate from a local chocolatier. The room was well appointed, comfortable, and nicely set up for business use (with automatic high speed internet and a comfortable desk). The lobby is a visual treat; they need to include pictures of it on their website. Loved every minute of my stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service

reviews.text: Hotel 43 is right in the middle of downtown Boise, 1 block away from the competitor, Grove Hotel. Six story building, small lobby, friendly desk people. You can tell the hotel has been re-done because the door to the rooms are marked up and not repainted since conversion. I had a fifth floor room and it was on the small side, the king bed, although very comfortable, dominated the room.
reviews.title: somewhat luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel 43 for two nights on a weekend getaway. it was recommended to us by a friend. It seems to mainly be a hotel catering to business people; it has that atmosphere. it is actually an old hotel redone with a very modern motif. The location is what is great. It is just across the street from Grove Plaza, a full block set aside for concerts, the sports arena, the conference center, and some shops. You are one block from the newest shopping area with fun shops and restaurants, and all of downtown is just a few blocks away.
reviews.title: Great Location, OK Hotel
Enjoyed our stay and Chandler's
reviews.text: The room we had was a boutique king; it was clean and well appointed, but nothing really special. There was free wireless internet. The staff was friendly and attentive, but we did have to call twice to get a phone to work in our room. Which reminds me that there is a $10/night fee for parking, whether you have valet or you do it yourself, and while the parking garage is just next door, it does get busy and crowded, so seemed easier to have the valet do it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat at the restaurant or have room service (it was very expensive). Overall, a decent hotel.
reviews.title: Hip, Central, Great Dinner Next Door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our stay, we were celebrating our 26th wedding anniversary. The dinner at Chandler's was excellent and we were both blown away by the jazz singing of Brianne Bower that night. The bed was most comfortable and staff very pleasant. The only complaint we had was the elevator on the left side kept getting stuck... which made us a little nervous to take it. We look forward to many more weekend get aways at Hotel 43, but in the mean time have become frequent visitors to Chandler's for their great food and fantastic jazz music.
reviews.title: Hotel 43...A Great Find

description: Hotel 43 conveniently located in the heart of downtown Boise is perfect for the business and leisure traveler. Each of our 112 guestrooms feature upscale furnishings and amenities reflecting our dedication to superior service and facilities. The hotel features panoramic views of downtown Boise and the Boise valley. Complimentary airport shuttle service is available for our guests convenience.Step outside our door and you are surrounded by beautiful Downtown Boise. Enjoy a wide variety of restaurants within walking distance such as PF Changs. Walk to the BoDo District/ the newest entertainment and shopping area downtown. Along the way you will find many delightful boutiques/ gift shops/ salons/ day spas/ jewelry stores/ art galleries and the State Capitol to explore. Visit the popular cultural attractions including the popular Basque District and Grove Street Illuminated public art display. Entertainment is abundant with the Egyptian, Edwards and Flicks theaters/ the Quest Arena and the Knitting Factory Concert House. Take a relaxing stroll on the Boise River Green Belt and visit several city parks or the one of a kind Anne Frank Human Rights Memorial. Business travelers will appreciate the convenient location to the Boise Convention Centre/ corporate headquarters and banking services.
